TopicTitle: Mechjeb 2 landing guidance doesnt work correctly

Articles.Content:
Hello! So I am testing my new reusable rocket with mechjeb 2.

The issue is, that when I pick a target on the map, it basically tries to land on the opposite side of what I picked.....

Here is a list of my mods that i currently have installed:

https://gyazo.com/a2e9bef29755289ff6cee0391bb98b5b

Here is a video showing the issue:
I had a problem like this. I was controlling the ship from the wrong part plus on another I had the control ring on upside down.

Hi  

I have the same problem. And the ship is controlling right. 

KSP 1.3.1 and MechJeb2 on MacOSX, throw Steam

this mod developer is constantly updating and fixing.. as you can see

 the last change log indicates they must have taken hours to do.. and recompile,

Thanks, for All they do, so we can have fun !

they have released a newer version and the report indicates they  have addressed this..I'm trying myself today 

https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/MechJeb2-Dev/changes

https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/MechJeb2-Dev/

GL

Hope this helps

Jammer

So last night I  landed  2 craft with  MechJeb2(751)(https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/MechJeb2-Dev/lastSuccessfulBuild) and no issue. I even changed course of the landing target at 35k on duna and it correctly landed the craft.. It was beautiful.

 Now I did build a straight 3 stage rocket with a separated landing craft. All very simple craft, but it was as smooth as could be

Thanks Again to Sarbian and KSP modders

Jammer

changed link to a more generic link to dev's site,

Edited November 30, 2017 by Jammer-TD

MechJeb's ability to land at specific locations is broken for me as well as of 754. It will land anywhere it wants, the absolute wrong side of a moon, 100km away, 10km away, etc vs the 50m accuracy from the targeted map location or object it used to have. Landing Guidance is like a box of chocolates, you never know what you're going to get.

It will land your craft most of the time without destruction, that is true, but not necessarily where you want.

Having this trouble, too-- I was thinking it was my design that was to blame.  Dev Build 751 referenced above should address the problem?

 

ETA  I see he's up to build 755, so he's obviously been busy... 

Edited November 21, 2017 by MaxwellsDemon
addition
I've noticed that the 'Land Anywhere' still seems to work.  Just seems to be the targeted landing system that's wonky.  (Just on the off-chance that information is useful.)
Dev builds 760 and following appear to have corrected this issue.

On 11/29/2017 at 7:43 PM, MaxwellsDemon said:

Dev builds 760 and following appear to have corrected this issue.   

Agreed, works for me now using dev build 762 from the link: MechJeb Last Successful Build

It will not update from CKAN correctly, you must use the link here.

Same, I updated to 769 and it still totally fails to land at target on the Mun. I'm in a high inclination orbit at 20k, landing in the Kopernicus crater. It started okay and aligned correctly, then it just went into a constant prograde burn while trying to do a 3.5m/s course correction.
